SENT.plain: A 79-year-old right-handed woman was admitted to hospital following sudden onset of severe visual loss in the left eye
Left central retinal artery occlusion (CRAO) was diagnosed
Diffusion-weighted imaging showed an asymptomatic hyperintensity in left middle cerebral artery territory
Transcranial Doppler and transesophageal echocardiography revealed patent foramen ovale
No other embolic sources were identified in the carotid artery, aortic arch, or heart
We report herein a case of CRAO caused by paradoxical brain embolism
